description: Hepatitis C is a type of viral hepatitisinfectious caused by the hepatitis C virus (HCV). HCV is a small, enveloped, single-stranded, positive-sense RNA virus. It is a member of the genus Hepacivirus in the family Flaviviridae. There are six major genotypes of HCV: Genotype 1 is the most common strain worldwide and it is considered to be the most aggressive, followed by genotypes 2 and 3.
name: Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Antibodies and Antigens
